people_also_ask.heading: A back-up camera, also called reversing camera or rearview camera, is a special type of camera attached to the rear of your vehicle. It helps you see the area behind your car when backing up. It often provides more visibility behind your car than you can get by turning your head.
people_also_ask.title: Back-up Camera - My Car Does What

people_also_ask.heading: As of May 1, 2018, all new cars in the United States must come equipped with backup cameras. The law requiring these cameras started its phase-in process in May 2016 and completed enforcement May 1, 2018.
people_also_ask.title: Are backup cameras required on new vehicles? (Updated)
